'Description': Pop-Folk singer from Sofia, Bulgaria. Mostly known by her stage name [b]Andrea[/b] (Cyrillic: Андреа). In August 2008 she sang a duet "Samo Moi" with Romanian singer & producer [a=Costi Ioniţă] and the song became a summer hit. Then they started to work together as [a=Sahara (10)]. In April 2012, Andrea left Sahara to pursue a solo career. Born: January 23, 1987
Aneliya Georgieva Atanasova (born July 1, 1982 in Stara Zagora, Bulgaria), best known as Anelia (or Aneliya, Aneliq, Anelia), is a Bulgarian pop-folk singer.

Galina Vicheva Gencheva born on May 21, 1985, in Smyadovo, Bulgaria, better known by her stage name Galena (Галена) is a Bulgarian singer. Galena attended music school in Shumen in popular song. Two years later she moved to the music school in Dimitrovgrad. Galena was discovered by the singer Milko Kalaidjiev. She started her career under the name Galia and recorded her first single "Možeš li", and her debut studio album as Galena came in 2006, with the self-titled Galena on Payner Music. Another song, a duet with Boris Dali titled "Namerih te" found an even bigger success. Every year better and better, now is one of biggest star in Bulgaria and one od first five star in Payner.

Galina Peneva Ivanova (Bulgarian: Галина Иванова Пенева) (born June 28, 1973 in Ruse, Bulgaria), better known on stage name as Gloria (Bulgarian: Глория), is a famous Bulgarian Pop, Dance, Rock, and Pop folk singer. Arguably the most popular of her generation, she is known as the Mother of pop-folk. Gloria has been a performer since 1990. Her second studio album Za dobro ili zlo sold over 600,000 copies making it the biggest selling album in Bulgaria. Her studio album Blagodarya was released in Bulgaria in March 2007 and it sold over 16,000 original copies within the first week of release.
A Bulgarian Hip Hop band from early 90's.
Serbian folk singer (born on 6 May 1951 in Šabac, Serbia - died on 17 February 2019 in Bielefeld, Germany), throned as "King of Folk" in the Balkans.

Nina Panayotova, known on the stage as Extra Nina / Ekstra Nina, was born on December 5th 1963 in Vratsa, Bulgaria. She is regarded as one of the legends of Bulgarian popfolk music, with 15 albums since 1996. She is also the older sister of popfolk singer Tzvetelina.

Ivana is a popular Bulgarian female singer. She is one of the most prolific performers in the pop-folk music style in Bulgaria. Ivana was born on January 31, 1969 in Aytos, Bulgaria. She graduated from the Svishtov University of Economics, and then studied at the Burgas Free University for one term before leaving the law for later. Meanwhile, Ivana married. She has a daughter whose name is Teodora.
Maria Panayotova Kirova (Bulgarian: Мария Панайотова Кирова) (born January 13, 1982), best known as Maria (Bulgarian: Мария), is a Bulgarian pop-folk singer.

[b]Tsvetelina Georgieva Yaneva[/b] (Bulgarian: [i]Цветелина Георгиева Янева[/i]), better known simply as [b]Tsvetelina Yaneva[/b] (Bulgarian: [i]Цветелина Янева[/i]), is famous Bulgarian pop-folk, pop, R&B and folklore singer. She is born in October 5th, 1989 in Plovdiv, Bulgaria. Her father is folklore musician [url=https://www.discogs.com/artist/2573113-%D0%93%D0%B5%D0%BE%D1%80%D0%B3%D0%B8-%D0%AF%D0%BD%D0%B5%D0%B2]Georgi Yanev[/url]. In her career she has two studio albums ("Na Parvo Myasto" 2010 and "Moga Pak" 2012) and one folklore album ("Dashterya Na Pesenta" 2012).

Erasure is an English synthpop duo, consisting of singer and songwriter [a40576] and songwriter and keyboardist [a37365]. They formed in London, and entered the music scene in 1985 with their debut single "Who Needs Love Like That".

'Description': Born on April 24, 1939 in Kubrat, Bulgaria. Bulgarian pop singer with deep and powerful voice. With career spanning for over 5 decades, she is often refereed to as "The queen of Bulgarian pop music". She represented Bulgaria in the [i]V Festival Internacional da Canção[/i] in Rio with the song [i]Реквием (Rekviem)[/i] in 1970.

'Description': Desislava Ivanova Doneva was born on 7 March in Radnevo, Bulgaria. Her musical stage performances began at an early age, when she began winning awards at festivals for children. Shortly afterwards, she became the main solo singer of orchestra "Radnevo". This allows her to be noticed by one of the most famous Bulgarian folklore singers of all time - Valkana Stoyanova, who takes her under her wing, studied her and declared Desislava as her only possible music heir among all of the students.

Kamelia Vladimirova Veskova (born 10 January 1971), better known as Kamelia, is one of the biggest Chalga stars in Bulgaria. She started her career in the mid 1990s and released her first album in 1998. Kamelia was born in Chiprovtsi, Bulgaria. She was discovered by Payner Music in 1997, the same year she signed a deal with Payner Studio. She was one of the first performers of the Chalga genre. Some of her most famous songs are: "Fire Girl", "Ti si", "Ti si vinoven", "Where Are You", "Zaleza i zorata" and "Luda po tebe". Kamelia posed for Playboy in 2006, and again in 2008.
Selma Bajrami (born 1980) is a Bosnian pop-folk singer.

Born on October 20, 1960 in Brčko, Bosnia-Herzegovina, Lepa Brena is the most famous and successful folk singer of the 80s in the former Yugoslavia. She now lives in Belgrade (married to Serbian tennis player Boba Živojinović) and owns a folk-pop label "[l=Grand Production]". Mother of [a=Stefan Živojinović] and [a=Filip Živojinović]
Serbian Pop/Folk star.
Galin Petrov Gochev (Bulgarian: Галин Петров Гочев), better known simply as Galin (Bulgarian: Галин), is popular Bulgarian pop-folk singer and rapper, born March 12, 1991 in Dobrich, Bulgaria.
Born on April 5, 1986 in Plovdiv, Bulgaria. He is the cousin of Cvetelina Yaneva.

Yanitsa Gospodinova Valkova (Bulgarian: Яница Господинова Вълкова), better known simply as Yanitsa (Bulgarian: Яница), is the famous Bulgarian pop-folk and folklore singer. She was born in September 22nd, 1982 in Ruse, Bulgaria.

[b]Iliyan Boydev[/b] (Bulgarian: [i]Илиян Бойдев[/i]), known simply as [b]Ilian[/b] (Bulgarian: [i]Илиян[/i]), is famous Bulgarian chalga singer. He is born in August 8th, 1982 in Veliko Tarnovo, Bulgaria. In his career he has one studio album and one live album.
Bulgarian Pop-Folk Singer
Bulgarina Singer of Pop-Folk and Bulgarian Folk Songs.

Рейхан е родена на 23 юли 1986 г. в град Ямбол. Музикалната ѝ кариера започва като вокалистка на оркестър „Кристал“, когато е едва на 15 години. Известност добива през следващата 2002 г. с издаването на първият ѝ самостоятелен албум „Рейхан и орк. Кристал“. В него е поместен и първият голям хит на певицата – „Кайнана“. В началото на 2003 г. печели наградата за Балкански клип на годината от „Планета ТВ“ за песента „Даянамам“. По-късно, през лятото огромен успех има песента „Имам нужда от теб“ в дует с режисьора Люси. В края на същата година излиза още един успешен дует – „Хубав си, сладък си“, заедно с Мариана Калчева. През март 2004 г., на церемонията по връчването на годишните музикални награди на сп. „Нов фолк“, представя втория си дует с Людмил Иларионов – „Обичам те“. Младата певица умира нелепо на 19 години след тежко боледуване, причинено от автомобилна катастрофа край Севлиево на 23 юли. Тогава на място почина приятелят ѝ Мартин Кискинов – Кезо, който управлявал колата и пътуващия на предната седалка саксофонист от орк. „Кристал“. В автомобила е пътувал и четвърти човек, който оцелява. Рейхан е с тежка черепно-мозъчна травма, счупен таз, разкъсан пикочен мехур и голяма белодробна травма. Веднага след инцидента певицата е настанена в болницата в Севлиево, в състояние на кома и апаратно дишане. В Габровската болница са и направени поредица от операции, които стабилизирали състоянието ѝ. Това позволило Рейхан да бъде преместена в „Пирогов“, където лечението ѝ продължило. Певицата се стабилизирала и излязла от кома, но лекарите я поддържали в медикаментозна наркоза. Няколко дни по-късно е преместена в Правителствена болница в относително стабилно състояние. Надеждите на лекарите били големи и жизнените показатели на певицата се стабилизирали. Две седмици след операцията състоянието ѝ внезапно се влошава и тя почива на 25 август 2005 г. Погребана е в Ямбол в съседство на по-голямата си сестра Севджан, която загива при подобни обстоятелства.

[b]Djena Valentinova Stoeva[/b] (Bulgarian: [i]Джена Валентинова Стоева[/i]), better known as [b]Djena[/b] (Bulgarian: [i]Джена[/i]), is Bulgarian pop-folk, pop and folklore singer. She's born in July 3rd, 1985 in Razgrad, Bulgaria.. In her career she has five studio albums, two folklore albums and two compilations.

Galina Dimitrova Ivanova known professionally as Kali (in Bulgarian: Кали) is a Bulgarian singer. She was born on October 1975 in Sofia. She has 3 children. She's best known for her 1998 song "4-4-2". It was a huge hit in the country due to Bulgaria's first appearance in the FIFA World Cup since 1994. Ivanova explained that the idea of the song was to give a motivational push to the Bulgarian team, and openly dislikes it. Kali has 7 studio albums, 1 duet album and 1 compilation album, all under different labels. She is signed with Payner since 2010
Raina Kirilova Terziyska is a Bulgarian pop-folk singer and singer of traditional music.

[b]Petya Koleva Ivanova[/b] (Bulgarian: [i]Петя Колева Иванова[/i]), better known as [b]Preslava[/b] (Bulgarian: [i]Преслава[/i]), is very famous Bulgarian pop-folk and folklore singer. She's born in June 26th, 1984 in Dobrich, Bulgaria. In her career she has six studio albums, five compilations and two video albums.

Дует Шик са Виолета и Красимир Гюлмезови. Виолета Гюлмезова е родена на 5 декември 1960 г. в Костинброд. Красимир Гюлмезов е роден на 10 февруари 1961 г. в Бургас. Краси е пример за човек, който почти всичко е постигнал сам. Рано загубва баща си и още като ученик започва да свири къде ли не на всички инструменти, които му попаднат. Прекрасен пианист, аранжьор и композитор, той завършва музикалното училище с виолончело и сега свири и записва много струнни инструменти. На 24 години печели "Кристалния камертон" в Полша за аражимента на песента "Този прекрасен свят", представена от Домино, а оркестър от сто души го аплодира. Вили отвори нова страница в неговата творческа биография. Песните и текстовете, последвали съвместния им живот са живо доказателство, че любовта е над всичко. Макар и наследничка на твърдоглав шопски род, Вили е човек с лъчезарен и благ характер. Прекрасните и гласови и физически данни я правят желан партньор във всяка група, но вродената и безкомпромисност не винаги и е била полезна в отношенията и с околните. Така след група Стил тя преминава в Домино, където освен професионална реализация открива и мъжа на живота си - Краси. Следват много години работа и успехи, но най-голямата и радост идва след един гурбет в Кипър - Вили става майка първо с Никола, после Рада. През 2008 г. Вили и Краси отпразнуваха 20-годишнината от началото на сценичната си дейност като дует Шик с голям концерт в зала 1 на НДК, а техен специален гост бе големия италиански певец и композитор Тото Кутуньо.

[b]Ani Fuk Chong Hoang[/b] (Bulgarian: [i]Ани Фук Чонг Хоанг[/i]), known simply as [b]Ani Hoang[/b] (Bulgarian: [i]Ани Хоанг[/i]), is Bulgarian pop-folk and hip-hop singer of Vietnamese descent. She is born in August 1st, 1991 in Sofia, Bulgaria. Her fiancée is Bulgarian music video director and singer [url=https://www.discogs.com/artist/3190699-%D0%9B%D1%8E%D0%B4%D0%BC%D0%B8%D0%BB-%D0%98%D0%BB%D0%B0%D1%80%D0%B8%D0%BE%D0%BD%D0%BE%D0%B2]Lyudmil "Lyusi" Ilarionov[/url]. In her career she has only one studio album.
Petra is one of the first Bulgarian chalga singers. Her best known song is "Hishtna Hiena" (Hyena-predator). Her music has been often described as satire and parody of the Bulgarian social life.

Luna one of the most successful and loved singer of the new Bulgarian music and is compared to Tina Turner. Her career is filled with many concerts, recognition and awards. 1999 - Awards of the magazine "New Folk" - the hit of the year here and there, here and there " 1999 - Awards of the magazine "New Folk" for the original stage presence 1999 - Awards Radio "Mila" - the hit of the year "Run, feet and the prize for best original stage presence 2000 - First National Awards popfolk Festival "Golden Mustang 2000 - Second Prize of the Jury for the year popfolk hit" Run, feet " 2001 - Second Prize of National popfolk Festival "Golden Mustang 2001 - the audience award for popfolk hit -" Run, feet " In 1996 Luna involved in mega-concert of the BNT in the International Fair in Plovdiv In 1997 Cynthia became the first Miss Folk chance in Petritch under the auspices of the BNT In 1997 Luna involved in mega-concert of the Sofia stadium "Lokomotiv" before 10 thousand people with the star of the Latin series Korayma Torres In 1998 the first annual awards of "New Folk" in the Hristo Botev Hall in Sofia Studentski Grad Moon comes on stage with Opel Tigre. In 1999 Luna involved in mega-awards show for the "Honey Radio" with the Serbian legend Vesna Zmiyanats In 2000 Luna realizes joint tour in Turkey Mustafa Chaushev. Their final concert is visited by nearly 50 thousand people.
Khabibi - Закирджан Халматов - Zokirjon Xolmuhammad o‘g‘li Habibiy (1890-1980) was an Uzbek poet

Малина Станчева Malina is born on 7th of June 1967 in Sevlievo, Bulgaria, but grew up and lived in Lovech, Bulgaria. Her first appearance on stage was at the festival "Trakia Folk 2000" with the song "Liubovnata strela". Later, she published her first video and song "Samo ti", which became hit. Malina has written many songs, but her big debut was with the song "Luda Svetlina", which means "Crazy light". After this song she published another two songs. Duets with her colleague "Azis" became hits in Bulgaria. She is one of all time payner star.

Serbian pop-dance band formed in 1996. Members: Čeda Čvorak - songwriter Maja Marković - vocals (1996-2006) Jelena Kovačević - vocals (2006-2007) Kristina Čanković - vocals (2007-2009) Zejna Murkić - vocals (2009-2010) Lidija Jadžić - vocals (2009-2016) Ivana Krunić - vocals (2010-2017) Teodora Mijušković - vocals (from 2017)
Serbian turbo-folk singer.

Famous Serbian pop-folk star. Svetlana Ceca Ražnatović was born in 1973. in Žitoradja, village near Prokuplje. On her family vacation in 1987. she sang something for herself in front of hotel and was heard by Mirko Kodić, composer and arranger. He instantly got her first record deal. Her first record was released in 1988. She got her first award on folk festival "Ilidža" in Sarajevo, with song "[i]Cvetak zanovetak[/i]". Song "[i]To, Miki[/i]" in 1990. put her on top of charts. Soon followed awards on "Poselo 202" and "Folk liga". She recorded track with Keba ("[i]U snu ljubim medna usta[/i]") In 1993. Ceca published the album "Šta je to u tvojim venama".  After the song "[i]Kukavica[/i]", written by Futa Radulović and Marina Tucaković, was rejected by Vesna Zmijanac, Mira Škorić and Ana Bekuta, Ceca accepted it and it became a very unlikeable song. In February 1995. she married Željko Ražnatović Arkan, and got two children, Veljko and Anastazija. In 1998. she became chairman of football club "Obilić". Arkan was murdered in January 2000 at the same place where they got married. In March 2003. she got arrested under suspicion of involvement in distribution of narcotics. Four months later she got out of jail.
